thread.title: Cowgirls close out ITA All-American Championships
thread.title_full: Cowgirls close out ITA All-American Championships

title: Cowgirls close out ITA All-American Championships
text: Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 4:00 PM Updated at 5:11 PM Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 4:00 PM Updated at 5:11 PM PACIFIC PALISADES, Calif. Oklahoma State womenâ€™s tennis wrapped up at the Riviera ITA All-American Championships on Saturday. The Cowgirl duo of Viktoriya Lushkova and Carla Tur Mari competed in the quarterfinals of the back draw, where they faced Alex Chatt/Maddie Lipp of Northwestern. Lushkova and Tur Mari dropped a tough match to the No. 34 Wildcat tandem, 8-3. Lushkova and Tur Mari finished All-American qualifying with four wins and only two defeats. Three of the four Cowgirl wins came against ranked opponents, including upsets of No. 19 Taylor Davidson/Caroline Lampl of Stanford and No. 24 Klara Fabikova and Karla Popvic of California. The Cowgirls return to action next week as they prepare to host the ITA Central Regional Championships in Stillwater. This will mark the second year the Michael and Anne Greenwood Tennis Center will serve as host. For more updates and information, follow @CowgirlTennis on Twitter. The Daily Ardmoreite Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 4:00 PM Updated at 5:11 PM
